thread.title: Elizabeth Warren Calls Into Maddow Show to Rail Against Being ‘Red-Carded’ by the Senate
thread.title_full: Elizabeth Warren Calls Into Maddow Show to Rail Against Being ‘Red-Carded’ by the Senate

author: Josh Feldman
title: Elizabeth Warren Calls Into Maddow Show to Rail Against Being ‘Red-Carded’ by the Senate

organizations.name: elizabeth warren calls into maddow show to rail against being ‘red-carded
senate elizabeth warren calls into maddow show to rail against being ‘red-carded

text:
Elizabeth Warren Calls Into Maddow Show to Rail Against Being ‘Red-Carded’ by the Senate by Josh Feldman | 10:34 pm, February 7th, 2017 video 
Senator Elizabeth Warren called into MSNBC tonight to speak to Rachel Maddow about being reprimanded by the Senate for her speech railing against AG nominee and Senate colleague Jeff Sessions . 
In short, Warren quoted Coretta Scott King ‘s letter slamming Sessions when he was up for a judgeship in the 80s, and some of the language she quoted led Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to reprimand her for being in violation of Rule 19 for impugning the character of a fellow senator. 
The Senate voted to uphold the ruling from the chair, and Warren told Maddow tonight she was “red-carded.” She expressed her frustration that she is not permitted to speak at all on the Senate floor when Sessions is the topic. 
Maddow asked her if she expected to start this controversy. Warren said no and implored everyone to read the full letter from King . 
Watch above, via MSNBC.
